chapter.title: Drools
chapter.para: The openengsb-drools component takes "events" as input and handles them using a rulebased system (JBoss Drools 5.0). The rules are managed independent of servicemix in the Drools Guvnor. Guvnor is a webapplication running inside a JBoss Application Server. The rulebase can be managed with the webinterface. For specifying conditions in rules a model is needed. A model is described in simple Java objects. The default model is located in the "workflow/drools/domains"-project. The following example shows how a rule can be specified.

orderedlist.listitem:
Login guvnor
Take the browser to the guvnor webinterface (e.g. http://127.0.0.1:8080/drools-guvnor) and login with your credentials.

Setup package
select "Knowledge Bases" in the sidebar and Create a new package named "org.openengsb".

Build and upload the model
Open a command-shell in the "workflow/drools/domains"-directory and execute "mvn install". This compiles the model and packs it to target/openengsb-workflow-drools-domains-VERSION.jar. Use the webinterface to upload the model by selecting "Create New->Upload POJO Model jar". Enter a name (e.g. "mymodel") and confirm the dialog. Now browse to the openengsb-workflow-drools-domains-VERSION.jar and upload it. When that is done click "save changes" in the top-left corner of the frame. Enter a commit-message (e.g. "add openengsb-workflow-drools-domains-VERSION").

Create a new rule with the webinterface
Select "Create New->New Rule" and enter a name for the new rule. Assign it to a category (does not influence functionality of the rule). Then choose which type of rule you would like to create. The easiest to use type is the "Business Rule (guided editor)". In the WHEN-area you may specify conditions (e.g. using the Event-model). In the THEN-area you may specify the actions. In actions you can modify the knowledge (e.g. the current event) or trigger actions in openengsb. To trigger actions select "call method on helper...". You can use information contained in the event by binding it to a variable. Click on the field in the when-condition and providing a variable name.

Compile the rulebase
For the changes to be applied for usage in the workflow the rules must be compiled. You only need to select the package (org.openengsb) in the sidepane and then click "Build package" in the right frame.
